description: From New Latin valvularis (“valvular”), from valvula (“valvule, small valve”) + Latin āris (“-ar: forming adjectives”).

entries.meaning: (medicine, biology) Of or pertaining to valves, such as those of the heart.
examples: It was Charles Sherrington (1857–1952) who named that valvular connection (later found to be a gap) the synapse.
